revision.text:
{{BLP primary sources|date=August 2010}} {{Infobox person | image = | caption = | name = Jason Narvy | birth_name = Jason Andrew Narvy | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1974|3|27|mf=y}} | birth_place = [[Los Angeles]], [[California]], U.S. | occupation = Screen actor, voice actor | yearsactive = 1993â€“present | spouse = Amy Schnetzer | known_for = [[Bulk and Skull|Skull]] in ''[[Power Rangers]]'' | URL = }} '''Jason Andrew Narvy''' (born March 27, 1974) is an American actor known for playing the role of [[Bulk and Skull|Eugene "Skull" Skullovitch]] on the various iterations of ''[[Power Rangers]]'' and film franchise from 1993 to 2012, beginning with ''[[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers]]'' in 1993.
==Career== Narvy grew up in [[Los Angeles]].<ref name=OfficialBio>[http://www.jasonnarvy.com/film-bio "Biography"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120109034148/http://www.jasonnarvy.com/film-bio |date=2012-01-09 }}. JasonNarvy.com. Retrieved October 1, 2013.</ref> He studied at the [[Lee Strasberg Theater Institute]]. He is best known for playing [[Bulk and Skull|Skull]], one half of the bullying rival duo on [[Fox Television]]'s children's TV series ''[[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers]]'',<ref>{{cite news|title=Borrowing From Bard for Bucks : Actor Jason Narvy will direct Newbury High students in an abridged version of 'Hamlet.'|date=May 26, 1994|first=Jane|last=Hulse|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|url=http://articles.latimes.com/1994-05-26/news/vl-62169_1_newbury-park-high-school}}</ref> a role he reprised on its spin-offs, ''[[Power Rangers Zeo]]'', ''[[Power Rangers Turbo]]'', and ''[[Power Rangers in Space]]'', before leaving the franchise to go to college. He made a [[cameo appearance]] in the last episode of [[Power Rangers Super Samurai]]. He also appeared in the feature film adaptations, ''[[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: The Movie]]'' in 1995 and the ''[[Turbo: A Power Rangers Movie]]'' in 1997.
He also supplied the voice of Combat Chopper on the sci-fi children's show ''[[Masked Rider (TV series)|Masked Rider]]''.
Narvy appeared in a lead role in a [[ABC Family|Fox Family]] pilot, ''Men in White''. He also appeared numerous commercials, public service announcements and voiced numerous toys, tie-ins, and video games for Fox, ABC, and Disney.
He received a [[Bachelor of Arts]] degree from [[Franklin and Marshall College]], and got his master's degree from [[Mary Baldwin College]], where he studied with the American Shakespeare Center, performing in the title role in ''[[Henry V (play)|Henry V]]'', ''[[Pericles]]'', and ''[[Hamlet]]''. He also appeared as Richard of Gloucester and Suffolk in a conflation of the Henry VI trilogy. Jason also worked with the Legitimate Theater Company of New York, a Lower East Side company that emphasizes new plays and experimental works.<ref name=ConcordiaU>[https://www.cuchicago.edu/faculty/theater/jason-narvy/ "Jason Narvy, PhD: Assistant Professor of Theatre"]. [[Concordia University, Chicago]]. Retrieved October 1, 2013.{{Primary source inline|date=October 2013}}</ref>{{Primary source inline|date=October 2013}}
Narvy is a certified actor/combatant with the British Academy of Stage and Screen Combat, a member of the Screen Actors Guild, and holds a PhD in Theater Studies from the [[University of California, Santa Barbara]].<ref name=ConcordiaU/> He is currently an associate professor in the Theatre Department at [[Concordia University, Chicago|Concordia University]] in Chicago.<ref name=ConcordiaU/>
To this date, Narvy remains very good friends with his co-stars [[Paul Schrier]] and [[Jason David Frank]].
==Filmography==
===Television=== *''[[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers]]'' - Skull *''[[Power Rangers Zeo]]'' - Skull *''[[Power Rangers Turbo]]'' - Skull *''[[Power Rangers in Space]]'' - Skull *''[[Power Rangers Lost Galaxy]]'' - Skull (cameo appearance, uncredited episode: Quasar Quest part 1) *''[[Power Rangers Wild Force]]'' - Skull (guest appearance, episode: ''[[Forever Red]]'') *''[[Power Rangers Samurai|Power Rangers Super Samurai]]'' - Skull (guest appearance)
===Voice-over=== *''[[Masked Rider (TV series)|Masked Rider]]'' - Combat Chopper (voice) *''[[Power Rangers Turbo]]'' - Skull's chimp form (voice, first half of season)
===Film roles=== * ''[[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: The Movie]]'' - Skull (1995) * ''[[Turbo: A Power Rangers Movie]]'' - Skull (1997) * ''Wicked Game'' - Guile Lydon (2002) * ''Penny'' - Mike (2010)
